Sentencas: Temperature-programmed reduction (TPR) was performed to investigate the reducibility of the NiO/YSZ composite that is related to the anode of solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs).
Titulo: Investigation of the interaction between NiO and yttria-stabilized zirconia (YSZ) in the NiO/YSZ composite by temperature-programmed reduction technique

Sentencas: The TPR profiles were found to be affected by preparation method, composition and pretreatment conditions.
Titulo: Investigation of the interaction between NiO and yttria-stabilized zirconia (YSZ) in the NiO/YSZ composite by temperature-programmed reduction technique

Sentencas: The calcination temperature strongly affected the reduction behavior; the TPR profile of the sample calcined at 1723 K shows a high temperature reduction peak that was not found in the TPR profile of the sample calcined at 1473 K. Such a difference in the TPR profiles can be attributed to the presence of distinct states of NiO species, which are due to the difference of interactions between NiO and YSZ.
Titulo: Investigation of the interaction between NiO and yttria-stabilized zirconia (YSZ) in the NiO/YSZ composite by temperature-programmed reduction technique

Sentencas: Five distinct states of NiO species are shown to be present in the NiO/YSZ composite.
Titulo: Investigation of the interaction between NiO and yttria-stabilized zirconia (YSZ) in the NiO/YSZ composite by temperature-programmed reduction technique
